Class RMIConnection

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.client.connections.RMIConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServerConnection
public class RMIConnection extends Object implements ServerConnection
A client side RMI connection to a remote game server.

  • Constructor Details

    • RMIConnection

      public RMIConnection(ThreadSafeMessageQueue<ClientMessage> inqueue, String server_ip, String username, int port) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException, NullPointerException
      Constructs a RMIConnection object.
      Parameters:
      inqueue - ThreadSafeMessageQueue Queue in which incoming messages will be inserted.
      server_ip - IP address on which the remote RMI Registry is running.
      username - Username with which the client wishes to connect to the server.
      port - Port on which the RMI Server is listening.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If the underlying RMI TCP channel is disrupted in any unrecoverable way.
      NotBoundException - If the requested server does not have any object bound to the requested string.
      NullPointerException - If the server refused the connection.

  • Method Details

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(ServerMessage message) throws RemoteException
      Send a ServerMessage to the server according to the underlying network implementation.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • getShutdownHook

      public Thread getShutdownHook()
      Specified by:
      getShutdownHook in interface ServerConnection
      Returns:
      A Thread object in charge of cleaning up any connection related resources at shutdown.
